meanings.definition: To make unattractive or unpleasant in appearance.
meanings.sent1: Using too much makeup can uglify your face.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti on the wall will uglify the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: Don't let the rain uglify your mood.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds began to uglify the once clear sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist's intention was to uglify the traditional portrait.

meanings.definition: To mar the beauty of; to deform.
meanings.sent1: A scratch can easily uglify the shiny surface of the car.
meanings.sent2: The construction work will uglify the natural landscape.
meanings.sent3: The spilled paint managed to uglify the entire room.
meanings.sent4: The lies began to uglify the once pure relationship.
meanings.sent5: The old building's decay started to uglify its historic charm.
